thread.title: Start September off right with martial arts expo, ranchera music, ghost tours this weekend - NewsBreak
thread.title_full: Start September off right with martial arts expo, ranchera music, ghost tours this weekend - NewsBreak

author: Cristina Rodda
title: Start September off right with martial arts expo, ranchera music, ghost tours this weekend - NewsBreak
text:
By Cristina Rodda ,
57 minutes ago
EL PASO, Texas ( KTSM ) — Hi El Paso! I’m Cristina Rodda with your weekly entertainment segment, KTSM 9 Que Pasa? I’m so excited to tell you about this weekend’s events. Let’s get started!
Texas Martial Arts Championship Expo
First up, the Texas Martial Arts Championship Expo at the El Paso County Coliseum! Are you ready for the BIGGEST martial arts expo in all of West Texas? This one-of-a-kind showcase brings together five incredible martial arts styles all under one roof. Whether you’re a seasoned martial artist, a curious beginner, or just looking for a high-energy event the whole family can enjoy, this is the place to be. It’s all happening Saturday, Sept. 6!
Texas Martial Arts Champions Expo
Alicia Villareal
Mexican Latin Grammy award-winning superstar Alicia Villareal is coming to the Plaza Theatre on Saturday, Sept. 6. The show promises a night of ranchera music. Her discography spans the creation of several albums over a twenty-year period. She is currently on tour and will make a stop in El Paso. For ticket information, click the link below.
Alicia Villareal – El Paso Live
Franklin Mountain Tours
If hiking is where you find your greatest adventures, we’ve got not one but two amazing treks lined up for Saturday, Sept. 6! By day, journey through the beauty of the desert on the Franklin Mountain Prospect Tour, where sweeping views and rugged trails make for an unforgettable escape. Then, as the sun sets, grab your lantern and head out on the Lantern-Lit Mine Tour, a magical nighttime adventure that brings history and mystery to life under the stars. Save your spot by calling (915) 444-9121.
Franklin Mountains State Park — Texas Parks & Wildlife Department
El Paso Museum of History
The El Paso Museum of History is a fun, family-friendly way to explore our city’s role in Texas history. Bring the kids, abuelita, and abuelito! Located in the Downtown Cultural Arts District, the museum is open Wednesday to Saturday, 10 a.m.–6 p.m., and Sundays, 11 a.m.–3 p.m. Don’t miss it— it’s history made fun for everyone!
El Paso Museum of History
Ghost 915 Ghost Tours
With the start of the -ber months, so is the start of spooky fun with two ghost tours this weekend! The first one is the Ghosts of the Camino Real San Elizario Spirit Walk, from 8-10 p.m. on Friday, Sept. 5, at the San Elizario placita.
One day isn’t enough? The second tour will be the Concordia Cemetery Ghost Tour, from 9 to 11 p.m. on Saturday, Sept. 6 at El Paso’s oldest cemetery. Learn the history of El Paso with a spooky twist!
For more information on ticket information, you can visit the link below.
Courtesy of Ghost 915 Tours San Elizario Ghost Tour
Concordia Cemetery Ghost Tour
El Paso Ballroom Dance Academy Free Country 2 Step Dance Class
Time to put on your boots and learn how to 2-step like a pro with this free class provided by the El Paso Ballroom Dance Academy! The beginner-friendly dance class will start at 4 p.m. on Sunday, Sept. 7 at the academy, located at 7220 N Mesa St. Call Joan Garcia to reserve your spot at (915) 585-0090 or email at Dance@danceelpaso.com
Free country 2-step dance class
City of Las Cruces Park and Recreation Dept: Movies in the Park series
Grab your lawn chairs, blankets and snacks to enjoy a free movie showing at the park this weekend with the City of Las Cruces Parks and Recreation Department. This Saturday, Sept. 6 the park will be showing “The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim” starting at dusk at 302 S. Main St.
For more information, you can call the Parks and Recreation Department at (575) 541-2550/TTY 711
Courtesy of the Las Cruces Park and Recreation Department Las Cruces Park and Recreation Department: Movies in the Park series
The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
The Mesilla Valley Film Society will be presenting a special showing of “The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert” at 7:30 p.m. on Sunday, Sept. 7 at the Fountain Theatre. This showing is in tribute to film star Terence Stamp, who passed away on Aug. 17 at the age of 87.
“The film became a surprise international hit and is now hailed as a groundbreaking work for its joyful and unapologetic portrayal of LGBTQ+ characters, helping bring queer stories into the cultural mainstream,” read the news release of the showing.
Tickets are available and can be purchased through the Mesilla Valley Film Society’s website.
Courtesy of the Mesilla Valley Film Society Mesilla Valley Film Society’s website
Look for KTSM 9 Que Pasa? online at KTSM.com and on our Facebook page every Thursday.
